intro: Argostemma vientianense, commonly known as the Laos moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Laos and Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
